description.text:
Our company is committed to being trusted voices of light and truth reaching hundreds of millions of people worldwide.
The Junior Machine Learning Engineer uses statistics, programming and machine learning techniques to analyze product, revenue, advertising, social and sales data to discover, predict, communicate and create opportunities for operational and product improvement. This person will be a key member of the Data Analytics department which works across all product teams within Deseret Digital Media, including KSL Classifieds, KSL Cars, KSL Homes, KSL Jobs, and KSL.com News. This person will create user-facing tools on KSL.com that leverage machine learning to improve the user experience for buyers and sellers on KSL.com’s digital marketplace.
This Is What You Would DoBuild automated solutions to improve user experience, product features, client solutions and business revenue such as:Content recommendation system for KSL News & KSL ClassifiedsClassification Models that parse textual data and categorize accordinglyNLP analysis on unstructured text for topic modeling and sentiment analysisPrice recommendations based on micro-economic measures within KSL.comPredict the length of time a good will remain for sale using time-series analysis, and micro-economic conditionsUnderstand, predict, and diagnose maladies in product user experience using user pathing and sequencingAnalyze network graphs for centrality to identify crucial interaction points on KSL.comCreate and maintain ETL workflows handling data from MongoDB, SalesForce APIs, Google Ad Manager APIs, and other systemsUnderstanding of descriptive and inferential statisticsMastery of Predictive Modeling and ML theory, including sample size determination, evaluating models, tuning, and creating tools that run efficiently in productionUse of Google Cloud Platform, Jupyter Notebooks, & Github to document extraction, transformation, analysis, simulation, learning and visualizationUse statistical and data science techniques such as regression, correlation, distribution, significance, Monte-Carlo simulations, neural networks, decision trees, attribution modeling, geo-spatial analysis, lift modeling, yield optimization and more to perform comprehensive analyses that produce predictive and prescriptive business insightsProduce accurate work and meet assigned deadlines
This Is What You Should Already Have
3+ years professional experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning EngineerAdvanced degree in statistics, mathematics, or computer programmingExpert in Machine Learning theory & techniques including neural networks, clustering, predictive modeling, etc.Python and SQL expertise is preferredExpert in statistical methods, e.g. regression, modeling, program measurement, time series, distribution analysis, correlation and multivariate testingBuilding models for imbalanced, and time series data sets. Bias/Variance tradeoff. Model quality metrics like R-squared, AUC, outlier detection and removalExperience implementing and conducting machine learningExperience in cloud-based data management and analysis environment (Google Cloud Platform)A passion for mentoring others and be eager to sharing his/her knowledge with other team members
Preferred
Experience with Google Cloud PlatformA portfolio of projects (GitHub, blog posts, academic papers, etc.)
Why DDM?
Our company follows a hybrid work model, meaning you’ll be able to do most of your work from home, but we’ll still meet in-person occasionally for team meetings and fun events. That means you’ll need to live in Utah or Idaho to be eligible to work for us.
In addition to all the standard things that happen to be great at DDM (like competitive wages, stability, and super benefits)…
We care about our contribution to the world. We not only care about the health of the business, we care about our impact on other humans. It's right in our mission statement – more than once.We take work/life balance seriously. No, really. We do. That's why we have a Flexible PTO policy. We care about what we do and we expect the work to get done on time, but we know there are extremely, vitally important things about your life outside of work, and we want you to take those things just as seriously.Exceptional insurance coverage, contributing 401(k) and retirement plan, transportation, and education benefits – even free on-site gyms.
Deseret Digital Media is an equal opportunity employer. Deseret Digital Media provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.
0

title: Jr Machine Learning Engineer (Hybrid - Remote, Utah)
